content.description:
The biggest challenge may be finding this rock. From Denver, go West on US Hwy 285, go South (left) on Foxton Rd, this Ts at the South Platte River, head East (left) to South Platte, then it curves South, go 3 miles. There is a prominent large boulder across the South Platte River just North of the parking area. Park where legal. 2 drainages can be hiked up. The North one has Atlantis Slab a short way up. Choose the South drainage. Hike 20 minutes or so. Find this rock just past Java Dome. Scramble up and around some boulders to past the South face of Java Dome and find Bali Dome abutting the right side of Java Dome. This route is the 2nd route from the left on this slab. Start on a gravelly bench. The 1st route may be hard to see.

This is a very runout and scary route that may invite the unwary beginner. Beware. The belayer should be ready to pull in lots of rope in the event of a fall. Protection is mostly mental. 4 (or 5) bolts (mostly in the beginning of the route) grace this 200+ foot pitch. Despite the topo in P. Hubbel's South Platte guidebook, the anchors are much more than 160 feet up. There is a significant runout above the 3rd bolt and an even more significant runout above the 4th bolt. Yes, it is slabbing, but I don't recommend falling. There is a left variation above the 3rd bolt, but it is better to smear straight between the 3rd and 4th bolts. We simul-climbed about 30 feet to reach the 2 bolt anchor and not to belay off a single bolt. Natural protection is very limited.

Per

James

: there is a 5th bolt. If you go straight past the 5th bolt, you can reach trees at ~200'.

Rap 180 feet angling right, well right of the route to a bench. Scramble down from here.
content.protection:
4 or 5 QDs, 230 foot rope, or simulclimb.

Per

Sylvia P

: there are now a pair of bolts with rap chains at the top of the cliff that were put in for the top pitch of

Girls on Surfboards

which can used as top anchor for Pee Wee and rap down using Girls using a 60m just fine.

climbs.name: Island in the Sun (Taylor Hinton Memorial)

content.description:
Island in the Sun is a nice slab route, closely bolted for first two pitches and spacing out for the lower angle 3rd pitch.

P

1 25m, 5.7+, 12 bolts. Start 20 feet left of

Island Express

on a blunt arete, just right of a large boulder. The crux is through the first two bolts and again moving through two eyebrows by the 4th bolt. Continue up slightly easier terrain to a two bolt anchor.

P2 25m, 5.7, 10 bolts. Start right off the anchor moving up consistent slab past 10 bolts to two bolt anchor staying well left of a small tree (some hollow flakes surround the small tree).

P3 25m, 5.2, 5 bolts. Continue up past 5 bolts to a shared chain anchor with

Girls on Surfboards

. As the angle eases, the bolts spread out.Descent: rap the route with a single 60 meter rope.
content.protection:
P1: 25 meters 12 bolts to two bolt anchor.

P2: 25 meters 10 bolts to two bolt anchor.

P3: 25 meters 5 bolts to shared chain anchor with

Girls on Surfboards

.
content.location:
This climb starts 20 feet climbers left of

Island Express

on a blunt arete just right of a large boulder.

content.description: Yawn.  This route was neither inspiring nor challanging, and if it had been it would be scary.  The Trout guide gives a good topo.  If you own the other guide, leave it in the car, it will only confuse you with regards to this route. Hike the south gully and find the jumble of boulders between Java Dome (left) and Bali Dome (right). Bushwhack perhaps 20 yards up between them, and find the first bolt on the right. That's the pro for pitch 1, 150'. Pitch 2 has three bolts and ends at another two bolt anchor, 150'.

Girls on Surfboards ascends a beautiful, reasonably protected, friction slab the whole way.

P1: 5.7, 28 m. The 'crux' is probably near the second bolt, but the climbing is pretty consistent.

P2: 5.7, 28 m. Again, the start of the pitch is the hardest. Â The bolts spread out as the angle eases.

P3: 5.2, 28 m. Use one of the "

Island Express

" anchor bolts, clip the bolt at the slightly steeper bit, then walk to the top anchor.

Rappel the route with a 60m rope. Rap anchors were removed.
content.protection:
Lots of hangers are missing.

P1. This

used

to have 9 bolts and chain anchors.

P2. This

used

to have 7 bolts and chain anchors.

P3: use

Island Express'

anchor plus one bolt to a chain anchor.
content.location: Start in the gap between the boulders filling the Java Dome/Bali Dome gully.

content.description:
Boys in Bikinis is a lovely, fairly well-protected climb starting on the lower right side of Bali Dome under the trees using mostly friction.

Pitch 1: 29m. The crux is 5.8+ or maybe 5.9 at second bolt utilizing very small footholds and slippery black lichen. This can be avoided by 5.3 ledge traverse to the third bolt instead. The remaining slab climbs smooth friction that is not slippery, 5.7.

Pitch 2: 29m. Climb through a less uniform section, and finish on a nice 5.7+ slab.

Optional pitch 3 to the top: ~36m. Use one each of

Girls on Surfboards

and

Island Express?

anchors plus one bolt to the anchors at the top, 5.3.
content.protection: P1: nine bolts, chain anchor. P2: ten bolts, chain anchor.
content.location: It is the route furthest right on Bali starting under the trees.
